name: Arrowhead Pharmaceuticals
core_thesis: Arrowhead's TRiM platform enables extra-hepatic RNAi delivery, differentiating from Alnylam's liver-focused approach. Near-term catalysts in obesity (ARO-INHBE) and approved Plozasiran provide multiple shots on goal.
one_liner: RNAi platform company with extra-hepatic (lung, muscle, adipose) delivery capability via TRiM technology

bull_case: TRiM platform enables delivery to lung, muscle, and adipose tissue â€” not just liver
Plozasiran (REDEMPLO) approved Nov 2025 - first RNAi therapeutic for APOC3 with 80% TG reduction
ARO-INHBE targets INHBE gene, a validated obesity pathway; Phase 1 data showed 6-9% weight loss
Zodasiran Phase 3 recruiting in HoFH with 65% LDL-C reduction
Amgen and Takeda partnerships validate platform and provide commercial infrastructure
Deep pipeline provides multiple shots on goal
bear_case: Alnylam dominates RNAi space with established commercial infrastructure
ARO-INHBE obesity data still early; 6-9% may not be competitive with GLP-1s (15-25%)
Partner concentration - Amgen and Takeda control key assets
Execution risk on extra-hepatic delivery claims

assets.name: Plozasiran
assets.one_liner: First RNAi for APOC3 with 80% TG reduction - approved Nov 2025

assets.name: Zodasiran
assets.one_liner: Dual LDL-C (65%) and TG (70%) reduction with quarterly dosing

assets.name: Fazirsiran
assets.one_liner: 96% Z-AAT reduction for AATD liver disease

assets.name: ARO-INHBE
assets.one_liner: Novel obesity approach with 6-9% weight loss, quarterly dosing, no GI AEs

assets.name: ARO-ALK7
assets.one_liner: Receptor-targeting approach to activin E obesity pathway

platform.name: TRiM (Targeted RNAi Molecule)
platform.description: Proprietary ligand-targeting chemistry enabling tissue-specific delivery of siRNA therapeutics
competitive_advantages: Extra-hepatic delivery capability differentiates from Alnylam
Quarterly dosing with deep, durable knockdown
Multiple tissue targeting from single platform
